s.text: Committee requests for GAO detailees should be in writing and be for specific purposes for a period not to exceed 1 year.
If a written product has been planned, the requesters or co-requesters must advise GAO of their withdrawal before the product is submitted for printing.
Notification of Ongoing Work
GAO's congressional policies and protocols apply to all investigative work conducted by the Office of Special Investigations unless an exception is specified herein or noted in advance.
These protocols are intended to provide clearly defined and transparent policies and practices relating to GAO's work.

Notification of Ongoing Work
These protocols are intended to provide clearly defined and transparent policies and practices relating to GAO's work.
GAO's congressional policies and protocols apply to all investigative work conducted by the Office of Special Investigations unless an exception is specified herein or noted in advance.

For testimony based on new work, regardless of whether it is a preliminary or final product, GAO will, consistent with professional auditing standards, hold an exit conference with agency officials before the written testimony is completed to (1) validate the accuracy of data gathered and (2) discuss the implications that flow from the data.
GAO's congressional policies and protocols apply to all investigative work conducted by the Office of Special Investigations unless an exception is specified herein or noted in advance.
These protocols are intended to provide clearly defined and transparent policies and practices relating to GAO's work.
Along with all members of the GAO team, I look forward to using these protocols to continue to serve the Congress for the benefit of the American people.
GAO will refer any person who wants a copy of a request letter to the Member who submitted it.
If any Member is interested in becoming a co-requester of GAO work, GAO will explain its policy on co-requests and refer the Member to the original requester.
GAO will refer any person who wants a copy of a request letter to the Member who submitted it.

In response to media inquiries about ongoing work, GAO will provide information only about the objectives, scope, and methodology of an assignment; the names of the requesters; and the expected completion date.

In response to media inquiries about ongoing work, GAO will provide information only about the objectives, scope, and methodology of an assignment; the names of the requesters; and the expected completion date.

GAO will strive to meet the Congress' needs within available resources and exercise the independence necessary to guarantee that its products and work conform to professional standards and the agency's core values of accountability, integrity, and reliability.

To effectively support the Congress, GAO must be professional, objective, fact-based, nonpartisan, nonideological, fair, and balanced in all its work.

Once a product is publicly released, GAO staff with expertise in the subject matter will answer questions from the media when asked.

These circumstances involve situations in which the request (1) addresses an important issue of broad interest to multiple committees or the Congress as a whole, (2) involves an issue that is a legislative priority or is on a fast legislative track, or (3) asks for a compilation of information which GAO has developed from a substantial body of prior work and/or work originally requested by others.
